item.title: Nigeria's AI Urgency: Collaboration Key to Avoiding Digital Marginalization
item.description:
Nigeria's telecom regulator and industry operators are issuing a stark warning: without urgent collaboration on AI infrastructure, the nation and continent risk falling behind in the global, AI-driven economy. This morning briefing delves into the call for local capacity building amidst massive international investments in AI.
Hosts: Host: Mr.-Breezy, Co-Host: Nkem
Category: Technology

item.title: Google's N3 Billion Bet: Supercharging Nigeria's AI Future
item.description:
In this episode, Charon and Tola discuss Google's substantial ?3 billion investment aimed at boosting AI talent and curriculum in Nigeria. They explore how this funding will revamp AI education in universities and polytechnics, adapting Google DeepMind's curriculum and training educators. The hosts analyze the potential impact of this initiative on positioning Nigeria as a digital skills hub, while also touching on the challenges and long-term vision.
Hosts: Host: Charon, Co-Host: Tola (Slay Queen)
Category: Technology

item.title: Yakata Extended: A Win for Shoppers, a Challenge for E-commerce?
item.description:
Konga's decision to extend its popular Yakata sale due to overwhelming shopper demand highlights the growing influence of e-commerce in Nigeria. This episode delves into the reasons behind the extension, the implications for consumers and the broader digital economy, and the persistent infrastructural challenges facing online retail in the country.
Hosts: Host: Samjay, Co-Host: Kore
Category: Technology

item.title: OPay's Resilience: Debunking Shutdown Rumours in Nigeria's Fintech Landscape
item.description:
This episode delves into OPay's swift response to viral shutdown rumors in Nigeria, exploring the facts behind the misinformation and its potential impact on user trust and the broader fintech ecosystem. We examine the role of social media in amplifying unverified claims and discuss the critical importance of clear communication and regulatory oversight in maintaining financial stability.
Hosts: Host: Peter Johnson, Co-Host: Aisha (Radio)
Category: Technology
